title: Critics Choice Awards: ‘Conclave’, ‘The Wild Robot’, ‘Shōgun’ Among Early Winners (Updating Live)
description: The 30th annual Critics Choice Awards are underway Friday at Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, launching a ceremony that had twice been postponed due to the L.A. wildfires that wreaked havoc on the city the past month. Chelsea Handler returns to host. Already, Conclave, the Focus Features drama that came in tied with Universal’s Wicked […]
author: Patrick Hipes
excerpt: The 30th annual Critics Choice Awards will honor the year's best films and television series.
text: The 30th annual Critics Choice Awards are underway Friday at Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, launching a ceremony that had twice been postponed due to the L.A. wildfires that wreaked havoc on the city the past month. Chelsea Handler returns to host. Already, Conclave, the Focus Features drama that came in tied with Universal’s Wicked with the most nominations overall with 11, won the night’s first award, for Best Ensemble. Universal/DreamWorks Animation’s The Wild Robot won for Best Animated Film. On the TV side so far, FX’s Emmy juggernaut Shōgun, which led the way with six nominations coming in, won both Supporting Actor and Supporting Actress categories. Watch on Deadline Colin Farrell, who transferred his Oswald Cobblepot from the big to the small screen for HBO | Max’s The Penguin, won for Best Actor in a Limited Series, while his co-star Cristin Milioti won for Best Actress. Check out the winners list below for the 21 movie and 20 TV categories in play and keep checking back as we update it throughout the evening. After Conclave and Wicked, Dune: Part Two and Emilia Pérez have 10 noms apiece for a ceremony that traditionally has served as a good Oscar bellwether. Last year, eventual Best Picture Oscar winner Oppenheimer scored a leading eight wins including the marquee Best Picture prize. Conclave, Wicked, Dune: Part Two and Emilia Pérez are nominated in Critics Choice Best Pic category this year alongside A Complete Unknown, Anora, The Brutalist, Nickel Boys, Sing Sing and The Substance. All but Sing Sing are up for the same award at the Oscars. On the TV side after Shōgun, ABC’s Abbott Elementary, Apple TV+’s Disclaimer, HBO | Max’s Hacks and The Penguin, Netflix’s The Diplomat and the final season of FX’s What We Do in the Shadows all have four noms coming in. This year’s Critics Choice Awards are airing live on the East Coast at 7 p.m. ET, and be tape delayed in the West until 7 p.m. PT on E! in the debut of a new deal with the network and Peacock. The show will air on the streamer beginning Saturday. Here’s tonight’s winners list: MOTION PICTURES BEST ANIMATED FEATURE The Wild Robot BEST ACTING ENSEMBLE Conclave TELEVISION BEST ACTRESS IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION Cristin Milioti – The Penguin (HBO | Max) BEST ACTOR IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION Colin Farrell – The Penguin (HBO | Max) BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS IN A DRAMA SERIES Moeka Hoshi – Shōgun (FX / Hulu) BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR IN A DRAMA SERIES Tadanobu Asano – Shōgun (FX / Hulu) BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION Jessica Gunning – Baby Reindeer (Netflix) BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION Liev Schreiber – The Perfect Couple (Netflix) BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS IN A COMEDY SERIES Hannah Einbinder – Hacks (HBO | Max) BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR IN A COMEDY SERIES Michael Urie – Shrinking (Apple TV+)
html:
The 30th annual Critics Choice Awards are underway Friday at Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, launching a ceremony that had twice been postponed due to the L.A. wildfires that wreaked havoc on the city the past month. Chelsea Handler returns to host.

Already, Conclave, the Focus Features drama that came in tied with Universal’s Wicked with the most nominations overall with 11, won the night’s first award, for Best Ensemble. Universal/DreamWorks Animation’s The Wild Robot won for Best Animated Film.

On the TV side so far, FX’s Emmy juggernaut Shōgun, which led the way with six nominations coming in, won both Supporting Actor and Supporting Actress categories.

Watch on Deadline

Colin Farrell, who transferred his Oswald Cobblepot from the big to the small screen for HBO | Max’s The Penguin, won for Best Actor in a Limited Series, while his co-star Cristin Milioti won for Best Actress.

Check out the winners list below for the 21 movie and 20 TV categories in play and keep checking back as we update it throughout the evening.

After Conclave and Wicked, Dune: Part Two and Emilia Pérez have 10 noms apiece for a ceremony that traditionally has served as a good Oscar bellwether. Last year, eventual Best Picture Oscar winner Oppenheimer scored a leading eight wins including the marquee Best Picture prize.

Conclave, Wicked, Dune: Part Two and Emilia Pérez are nominated in Critics Choice Best Pic category this year alongside A Complete Unknown, Anora, The Brutalist, Nickel Boys, Sing Sing and The Substance. All but Sing Sing are up for the same award at the Oscars.

On the TV side after Shōgun, ABC’s Abbott Elementary, Apple TV+’s Disclaimer, HBO | Max’s Hacks and The Penguin, Netflix’s The Diplomat and the final season of FX’s What We Do in the Shadows all have four noms coming in.

This year’s Critics Choice Awards are airing live on the East Coast at 7 p.m. ET, and be tape delayed in the West until 7 p.m. PT on E! in the debut of a new deal with the network and Peacock. The show will air on the streamer beginning Saturday.

Here’s tonight’s winners list:

MOTION PICTURES

BEST ANIMATED FEATURE

The Wild Robot

BEST ACTING ENSEMBLE

Conclave

TELEVISION

BEST ACTRESS IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION

Cristin Milioti – The Penguin (HBO | Max)

BEST ACTOR IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION

Colin Farrell – The Penguin (HBO | Max)

BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS IN A DRAMA SERIES

Moeka Hoshi – Shōgun (FX / Hulu)

BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR IN A DRAMA SERIES

Tadanobu Asano – Shōgun (FX / Hulu)

BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION

Jessica Gunning – Baby Reindeer (Netflix)

BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR IN A LIMITED SERIES OR MOVIE MADE FOR TELEVISION

Liev Schreiber – The Perfect Couple (Netflix)

BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS IN A COMEDY SERIES

Hannah Einbinder – Hacks (HBO | Max)

BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR IN A COMEDY SERIES

Michael Urie – Shrinking (Apple TV+)
